$id: [REPLACE with full github url to this json file]
title: Organization
description: The organization(s) involved in the incident. At least one organization, the victim organization, should be included as part of an incident bundle. There may be other organizations involved, such as a competitor organization that benefitted from stolen data or pass through organization that received kickbacks. The victim organization(s) include all organizations negatively impacted by the incident, not just the organization(s) that employed the insider.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "organization--" and is appended with a UUIDv4.

name.description: The name of the organization. E.g., "Company XYZ, Inc."

city.description: The city where the organization is located. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected or use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected.

state.description: The state where the organization is located. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected or use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected.

country.description: The country where the organization is located. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected or use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected. Public implementations should use the standard codes provided by ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the organization. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected or use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected.

small_business.description: TRUE if the organization is a privately owned business with 500 or fewer employees.

industry_sector.description: Top level category for the economic sector the organization belongs to.

industry_subsector.description: Second level category for the economic sector the organization belongs to. This value MUST map back to industry_sector. E.g., if sector is "9", subsector must be "9.x"

parent_company.description: Name of the organization's parent company, if applicable.

incident_role.description: The organization's role in the incident.

oneOf.title: Agriculture and Mining
oneOf.description: Growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, or extraction of naturally occurring minerals.

oneOf.title: Utilities
oneOf.description: Provisioning of services for the public (e.g., energy, water, and waste collection).

oneOf.title: Construction
oneOf.description: Construction and engineering of buildings and associated support services or trades.

oneOf.title: Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Mechanical, Chemical, Physical changes to material.

oneOf.title: Trade
oneOf.description: The exchange of goods and services.

oneOf.title: Transportation and Support Services
oneOf.description: Services directly or indirectly involved in the movement of people.

oneOf.title: Information Technology
oneOf.description: Hardware or software systems related to the processing, communications, and accessing of information.

oneOf.title: Finance and Insurance
oneOf.description: Financial services, payment processors, and insurance.

oneOf.title: Real Estate and Rental/Leasing
oneOf.description: Property sales and renting/leasing of assets.

oneOf.title: Professional Services
oneOf.description: Services provided by trained professionals in specialized fields.

oneOf.title: Education
oneOf.description: Instruction and training of individuals.

oneOf.title: Healthcare and Social Services
oneOf.description: Medical care and social advocacy/assistance.

oneOf.title: Arts, Entertainment, Recreation, and Hospitality
oneOf.description: Industries that meet the entertainment needs of patrons.

oneOf.title: Religious Institutions, Charities, and Non-Profits
oneOf.description: Any religious organization, charity, or non-profit.

oneOf.title: Public Administration
oneOf.description: Federal/State/Local administration and the oversight of public programs.

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other sector not listed in this vocabulary.

oneOf.title: Agriculture and Forestry
oneOf.description: Establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, and harvesting timber from a farm or natural habitat.

oneOf.title: Fishing and Hunting
oneOf.description: Establishments concerned with expediting, guiding, and transporting hunting/fishing adventures, as well as those involved lodging operations, shooting preserves and fishing charters.

oneOf.title: Mining and Quarrying
oneOf.description: Establishments that engage in mining, mine site development, and beneficiating metallic and nonmetallic minerals.

oneOf.title: Oil and Gas Extraction
oneOf.description: Establishments that operate and/or develop oil and gas field properties.

oneOf.title: Energy
oneOf.description: Providing sources of energy to physical facilities or residences.

oneOf.title: Water (Distribution and Sewage)
oneOf.description: Providing water to physical faciities or residences, and the extraction of waste water from such locations.

oneOf.title: Waste Collection
oneOf.description: The collection of disposed materials from physical facilities or residences.

oneOf.title: Nuclear (Power, Materials, and Waste)
oneOf.description: Provisioning of services for power, materials, and waste disposal related to nuclear facilities.

oneOf.title: Dams
oneOf.description: Industrial water dam facilities for managing irrigation, drinking water, flood control, etc.

oneOf.title: Residential
oneOf.description: The construction of physical structures for residential use.

oneOf.title: Non-Residential
oneOf.description: The construction of physical structures for non-residential commercial or public use.

oneOf.title: Civil
oneOf.description: The construction of physical infrastructure for the facilitation of societal use (i.e. bridges, roads, dams).

oneOf.title: Architecture
oneOf.description: The planning and design of physical structures.

oneOf.title: Food and Beverage
oneOf.description: The manufacturing of human consumables.

oneOf.title: Chemical
oneOf.description: The manufacturing of substances used for industrial purposes (i.e. cleaning products, agricultural practices)

oneOf.title: Aerospace, Auto, Marine, and Machinery
oneOf.description: The manufacturing of large scale complex technological physical systems (i.e. cars, ships, planes, sattelites).

oneOf.title: Electronics
oneOf.description: The construction of small scale complex technological systems (i.e. phones, computers, appliances)

oneOf.title: General Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Manufacturing of general products.

oneOf.title: Retail Trade
oneOf.description: The exchange of individual goods to consumers at merchant store locations.

oneOf.title: Wholesale Trade
oneOf.description: The exchange of bulk goods to other vendors for downstream retail trade.

oneOf.title: E-Commerce
oneOf.description: The exchange of individual or bulk goods to consumers or other vendors facilitated by the internet.

oneOf.title: Air
oneOf.description: Transportation and related services facilitated via air travel (i.e. planes).

oneOf.title: Rail
oneOf.description: Transportation and related services facilitated via rail travel (i.e. trains).

oneOf.title: Water
oneOf.description: Transportation and related services facilitated via water travel (i.e. ships).

oneOf.title: Truck
oneOf.description: Transportation and related services of goods via road travel for supply chains, done with large vehicles.

oneOf.title: Transit
oneOf.description: Transportation and related services for the movement of people (i.e. metropolitan busses, ferries, subways).

oneOf.title: Pipeline
oneOf.description: The transportation of resources via underground pipes (i.e. gas, water, sewage).

oneOf.title: Courier Services
oneOf.description: The delivery and related services for the distribution of goods or physical messages.

oneOf.title: Supply Chain Services
oneOf.description: Services related to the logistics for acquiring, processing, and transporting materials.

oneOf.title: Software Publishers and Web Developers
oneOf.description: Organizations that create and distribute software products and internet websites.

oneOf.title: Telecommunications
oneOf.description: Facilitation of the transfer and communication of information via technology (i.e. landline, 5g, ISP).

oneOf.title: IT, Data Processing, Hosting, Etc.
oneOf.description: Services that facilitate the operations of information systems.

oneOf.title: Banks and Credit Unions
oneOf.description: Organizations which provide banking and credit services

oneOf.title: Insurance
oneOf.description: Organizations that provide contracts for remediating unforeseen losses.

oneOf.title: Other Financial Services
oneOf.description: Other organizations that provide financial adjecent services (i.e. accounting, auditing, consulting, advisory).

oneOf.title: Real Estate Sales/Rentals
oneOf.description: Facilities that can be permanently or temporarliy made available for residential or commercial use.

oneOf.title: Warehousing & Storage
oneOf.description: Facilities that are used for the safekeeping of physical assets.

oneOf.title: Automotive & Machinery Rental/Leasing
oneOf.description: Vehicles and industrial machinery that can be temporarily lent out or leased.

oneOf.title: Legal
oneOf.description: Legal advice and representation by professionals.

oneOf.title: Consulting
oneOf.description: Expert advice in a specific field for clients.

oneOf.title: Scientific Research and Development
oneOf.description: Discovering new science or creating new technology.

oneOf.title: Manual Labor and Related Services
oneOf.description: Physical work done by hand or with simple tools.

oneOf.title: Business Services (Marketing, PR, etc.)
oneOf.description: Services that help businesses function (accounting, marketing, etc.).

oneOf.title: Labor Unions
oneOf.description: Groups representing workers in bargaining with employers (wages, benefits).

oneOf.title: Elementary/High Schools
oneOf.description: Formal education after primary school.

oneOf.title: Colleges/Universities
oneOf.description: Higher education leading to a degree.

oneOf.title: Technical/Industry Training
oneOf.description: Job-specific skills training.

oneOf.title: Private Practices, Walk-in Clinics, Etc.
oneOf.description: Outpatient medical care by individual providers.

oneOf.title: Advocacy Services
oneOf.description: Support for people's rights in healthcare.

oneOf.title: Psychological Practice
oneOf.description: Mental health diagnosis and treatment by psychologists.

oneOf.title: Pharmacology
oneOf.description: Study of drugs and their effects.

oneOf.title: Hospitals
oneOf.description: Inpatient care facilities providing medical and surgical services.

oneOf.title: Health Network
oneOf.description: Coalition of healthcare providers working together.

oneOf.title: Healthcare Insurance
oneOf.description: Financial protection for medical expenses.

oneOf.title: Diagnostics, Support Services, and Medical Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Tests, equipment, and supplies used in healthcare.

oneOf.title: Performing Arts & SPectator Sports
oneOf.description: Live entertainment (theater, concerts, sports) for audiences.

oneOf.title: Museums & Historical Sites
oneOf.description: Places that preserve and exhibit objects or locations of interest.

oneOf.title: Content Publishers
oneOf.description: Create and distribute information (books, newspapers, websites).

oneOf.title: Hotels, Amusement, Gambling, and Restaurants
oneOf.description: Hospitality, entertainment, and leisure services (accommodation, theme parks, casinos, dining).

oneOf.title: Religious Institutions
oneOf.description: Places of worship (churches, mosques, etc.).

oneOf.title: Charities
oneOf.description: Organizations helping others (donations, volunteering).

oneOf.title: Non-Profit Organizations
oneOf.description: Groups focused on social good, not profit.

oneOf.title: Civic Associations
oneOf.description: Community groups promoting civic engagement.

oneOf.title: Federal Government
oneOf.description: National government of the United States.

oneOf.title: State Government
oneOf.description: Government of a particular state or region of a country.

oneOf.title: Local Government
oneOf.description: Government of a city, county, etc.

oneOf.title: Defense Industrial Base
oneOf.description: Businesses supplying the a military.

oneOf.title: Correctional Facilities
oneOf.description: Prisons, jails, and other detention centers.

oneOf.title: Emergency Services
oneOf.description: Police, fire departments, and ambulance services.

oneOf.title: Postal Services
oneOf.description: Delivery of mail and packages.

oneOf.title: Department of Defense
oneOf.description: Military or government agency that oversees the military.

oneOf.title: Beneficiary
oneOf.description: The organization accepted trade secrets, customer lists, intellectual property, etc. that the insider obtained through the incident.

oneOf.title: Primary Victim
oneOf.description: The organization was the primary victim organization of the insider's actions.

oneOf.title: Secondary Victim
oneOf.description: The organization was a secondary victim to the incident. E.g., An organization that relied on the primary victim's services in order to conduct their business.

oneOf.title: Trusted Business Partner
oneOf.description: The organization has an alliance (contractually, bonded, etc.) with the victim organization.

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other role not described by this vocabulary.
